name: Le Clos Des Freres Gris

reviews.text: Our stay at the Clos des Freres Gris was the conclusion of my four week visit to France. After three delightful weeks in Paris we were ready for the Provencial countryside. The warm welcome we received from Caroline LeComte was representative of our entire stay. We were given beautiful rooms and delicious breakfasts. Attention when we needed it and space when we did not. The Inn is small enough that we felt like we were living in Provence with the added benefit of meeting some other people and benefiting from their travel experiences. The location is spacious, relaxed and beautiful. The Clos is recently and lovingly renovated. It is a visual pleasure and the pool is delightful. I only learned after I arrived of Caroline’s quilt and fabric arts passion. She has a notable collection of antique American quilts and fabrics which are magnificently displayed in the “chapel.” The Inn is close to the major roads so travel is easily accessible, and Caroline keeps a well stocked library of maps and information. She is a wonderful resource for everything from the best place to eat to the shortest route to the Marseilles airport. One week was barely enough time to see all the wonders of Provence and as I imagine returning I can not think of staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Perfect Conclusion to a Month in France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I learned about Le Clos des Freres Gris through Trip Advisor and my husband and I decided to book a stay there for a three-night trip to Provence. It was a lovely place to stay - the gardens are gorgeous, the building is lovingly restored, the rooms are charming and the decor in all parts of the inn is beautifully Provencal. Caroline, who owns and runs the inn with her husband, is a perfect hostess, offering lots of information and hospitality to guests. The breakfasts are fresh and delicious and the jams that Caroline makes to accompany the meal are the best I've had. I would without hesitation recommend Le Clos to anyone traveling to Provence! Le Clos des Freres Gris is located a very short drive from Aix-en-Provence. It's the best of both worlds - close proximity to beautiful Aix with its restaurants, shopping and historical sites, but in the tranquil countryside.
reviews.title: An absolutely lovely place to stay

likes.liked: — The beauty of the place and Caroline, the hostess

reviews.text: Our experience at Les Clos was absolutely wonderful-a true experince en provence as well as a textile lover 's treasure trove. What has been written before is accurate and reflective of our five days, but for me it was enhanced further by a visit to the Chapel within Les Clos. Caroline's collection of quilts, fabrics, samplers, linens and all the accoutrements of a textile artist was a rare find and her willingness to share this just made this home warm and welcoming! A place not to be missed.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience en Provence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the fantastic reviews here on Trip Advisor, I booked our 3 night stay at Le Clos des Freres. It was the best decision ever! I can't say enough good things about the stay...everything was great, from the beautiful rooms and circa 1789 building (lovingly restored) to the warm and gracious hosts and her incredible breakfasts! Fresh breads and croissants with the most amazing home made preserves and jams, fresh eggs with herbs from her impressive gardens, an array of cereals, fresh fruits and juices. All with an assortment of teas and great coffees. The grounds are filled with beautiful flowers and trees, the aforementioned gardens, a large swimming pool and a great bocce ball (petanque in France, I think) court. There is a very relaxing common area downstairs, with an amazing collection of travel information, menus and brochures from the area. Their recommendations for restaurants were excellent, as were their directions and parking advise. We had gorgeous weather while there and spent a good deal of time outside reading, and playing guitar, enjoying the wonderful smells of all the flowers and herbs. Just a quick drive into town, the TGV station or Marseilles airport. We had an extra day at the end of our trip, nearly three weeks later, and were lucky enough to be able to stop back by on our way home for one more night at Le Clos des Freres Gris. I've been lucky enough to do a lot of traveling in my life, and I would seriously consider this one of the best B&B's I've had the pleasure of visiting. You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: The perfect place!

likes.liked: — I can't pick just one thing!

reviews.title: The true "flavor" of Provence
reviews.text: There is probably not enough room on this site to adequately describe how superb our stay Le Clos des Freres Gris was the first week of May. We were visiting France from the United States for the first time, so we were not too sure what to expect. From the day we arrived, Caroline and her family made us feel very welcome. Caroline, who speaks fluent English, has completely restored this home into a beautiful "authentic" French Country Bed and Breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful and charming little place.
reviews.title: true flavour of provence

reviews.text: Attention is paid to every detail, from the tasteful provençal decoration to small luxuries like fluffy bathrobes and l’Occitane bathroom products. Caroline and her family provide just the right warm, non-invasive welcome. Great surroundings and nice pool. Good value for money.
reviews.title: A real taste of Provence
No aches in Provence
reviews.text: Caroline is a wonderful hostess. She is friendly, knowledgeable, and honest with her suggestions. The B&B, although recently renovated, seems to have been there forever. We really felt like we were in Provence and not just anywhere in the world. The rooms are very spacious, as are the bathrooms, with every amenity. Breakfasts were delicious. I particularly liked the homemade granola. The common room is also user friendly with a sink and refrig if you want to bring home a picnic. The location is great. You're in the country but a ten minute drive to the center of Aix. Caroline also has beautiful handmade gifts for sale tucked away under the stairs, so you have to look for them. She doesn't push them on you. I only found out by accident that she made them. What a keepsake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a visit to Aix-en-Provence, an attractive, bustling but relatively small city, a suggested accommodation is the Clos des Freres Gris. This is a large farmhouse in a rambling private garden a simple ten minute drive from the city centre and offers four spacious and comfortable rooms with en suites, each decorated differently but with much care and style by co-owners Carolyn (from Texas) and her French husband Hubert. Located at the end of a leafy driveway, the site provides secure on-site parking. Clos des Freres Gris is a B & B offering delicious and varied home-made breakfasts served in the clear Provencal light of a sunny courtyard or in the cosy sitting room. Drinks are available at all times and there is a swimming pool in the tree-studded garden for those wishing just to relax. A passionate advocate for the surrounding countryside, Carolyn can recommend a wide array of places to visit and photograph, either as day-trips or for a lazy lunch. The city has many bars and restaurants and a large underground carpark avoids the need to search for a space in the streets. Aix is an ideal base for exploring the Bouches du Rhone and the glorious Luberon and Vaucluse areas. The TGV station is only a direct fifteen minute drive from Clos des Freres Gris and has car rental facilities, making it easy to pick up or return a vehicle on the way to or from Paris which is only a two and a half hour train ride away.
reviews.title: Terrific B&B!

likes.liked: — Beautiful countryside setting, gorgeous decor, and wonderful hospitality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your travels take you to Aix and you are looking for a B&B you will love the Les Clos Des Freres Gris. Caroline and Hubert are most gracious hosts and the property is a beautiful estate. It is on the outskirts of Aix but only a 10 minute easy drive to the Rotunde. Caroline prepares wonderful omlets daily and she is a great resource for activities and restaurant recommendations in the area. We've been travelling to Europe for 20 years and stayed in countless B&B's but Caroline's is at the top of our list.
reviews.title: Spectacular!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Clos Des Freres Gris, is a beautiful Bed and Breakfast located in Aix-en-Provence. It's a lovely old house which has been lovingly restored by it's owners Caroline and Hubert.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth............I'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is in the most idyllic setting. It has it's own pool and Caroline grows her own fruit and vegetables. There are lots to do around the house if you decide to chill out, boules, internet, swimming, sunbathing, and reading. Caroline has put together a very comprehensive guide to the area of where to go and what to see.
reviews.title: Don't bother looking elsewhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 night in May 09. We were in the Côté Cour room which was decorated in a rich blue colour scheme. The room has everything a top hotel room would have only with much more charm. Hair-dryer, bottled water, dressing gowns, a shower to die for and then there was the bed one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.
reviews.title: A home away from home - best B&B experience ever

reviews.text: Each morning Caroline provided everyone with a cooked breakfast. The two mornings we're were there we had omelette and quiche, both fresh, home made and delicious. The thing I enjoyed the most was her gorgeous home made jams and marmalade.
reviews.title: It's what you dream of when you think of Provence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got engaged while we were staying here and Caroline gave us our first bottle of Champagne to celebrate and as if that wasn't enough she gave us a very nice salt and pepper set the morning we left.
reviews.title: Pure Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at this B&B. I echo the comments of many of the previous reviewers. Caroline, Hubert and their daughter, Charlotte, were wonderful hosts. Caroline was very responsive to all of our questions and ensured that we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. She had great tips on places to eat and visit in and an around Aix-en-Provence. The breakfasts provided were wonderful - the staples were croissants, bread, fruit, and wonderful cereals, and were supplemented by fresh fruit salad, and omelettes (Caroline knew we had a craving for eggs, since we'd been on the road for so long!). The B&B is located about 3kms outside of Aix-en-Provence and is situated on 2 acres, complete with swimming pool, patios, bocce court and flower/vegetable gardens. We had a picnic out on the patio with all the goodies we bought at the market, and Caroline even supplied us with some wine to drink with our food! The rooms (I took a peek at all of them) were all spacious and nicely decorated with hand-made quilts and pillows. The bathrooms were well equipped with fluffy towels, robes and toiletries from L'Occitane, and large, rainfall shower heads. The bed was amazingly comfortable, with a good quality mattress, nice linens and a cozy duvet. If you're looking for a romantic or relaxing getaway in Provence, this is the place to go to! We've stayed at a lot of B&Bs throughout Europe and North America, and we'd have to say that Le Clos Des Freres Gris is one of the best! It's the type of place you dream about staying at when you think of vacationing in Provence.
reviews.title: Loved our stay here!
A woundeful AIIx experience
reviews.text: The reason we chose to stay in Le Clos is because the reviews were so unanimously excellent that we had no doubt that it would be the right place for us. We stayed 5 nights over the Easter holidays at this lovely property, with beautiful grounds where we loved to stroll around everyday. The bedrooms are spacious and all have a view to the garden. Our bed was very comfortable. Very good quality linen. We had fresh bottled water in the room everyday. Luxury bathroom with a power shower to die for. Nice soft white bathrobes and towels. L'Ocitane products were replenished everyday. Breakfast was plentiful, with fresh brewed coffee every morning, an assortment of croissants, pain au chocolat, fresh bread, little cakes and cheese, 4 different flavours of home made jams, fresh fruit juice, tea. Wine in the evenings supplied.

Caroline is the perfect host, always making sure we had everything we needed and making us feel at home. She also gave us good recommendations on restaurants, sightseeings and locals events. She did reservations, supplied us with good maps and useful information of where to go.
reviews.title: A 5 Star Premium Experience and a Superior Value

likes.liked: — The property and hostess exceeds all your expectations

reviews.text: In short, we had a wonderful time, spent in an idyllic location, close to the city centre - about 5-10 minutes drive. We coudln't have chosen a better place with excellent value for money. We loved it so much, that we are going back in August, when we hope to be able to enjoy the swiming pool.
reviews.title: It's True.....
